oai_dc:dc.dc:title: J. W. Barnes, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A published photo from the Nashville Times (1940), of J. W. Barnes, the last surviving CSA Veteran. James W. Barnes was with Company I, 55th (McKoin’s) Tennessee Infantry and Company I, 44th Tennessee Infantry. Barnes was born on June 16th, 1843, in Burke Hollow, Williamson County, Tennessee. The 44th Tennessee Infantry Regiment was first organized at Camp Trousdale, Tennessee, on December 16th, 1861. There is an autobiography about the Confederate soldier available online at http://www.tennessee-scv.org/4455/barnes.html Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Barnes, James W., 1843-1944
